Posts.Content: If I were you I would ask to be reffered to a breast specialist and see what they have to say or what they may want to do to be SURE you are ok... Good Luck!!
Posts.Title: Need advice/ Fybrosistic breasts

Posts.Content: I am really sorry to hear that. I had a head full of hair too. Mine did come back but it is much thinner than it was before. I wish they could come up with something to make you hair come back and come back as long as it was and the same. Mine was down to m rear. I have hair and I am very glad. I just miss the way it was....
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I am taking Femara it is is the same class as to what you are taking and yes it can cause hair thinning. Mostly on the top. My doctor told me that suppressing the estrogen(which is what we want to do) causes the hair thinning. It is just like when a women go thru menapause same thing pretty much. Your estrogen level goes down then too and you get the male pattern balding.
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I went thru chemo for breast cancer and I went bald after my first treatment. Very tired and  irritable all the time. A feeling of tired that you really cannot describe utill you have experienced it. I had bad night sweats (still do). Just make sure to protect yourself every way that you can for your own health. I bought and wore mask from the time I started chemo till I was done with radiation. That was from september 2006 till april 2007. I went thru treatment during flu season too the mask seemed to help. This was the toughest thngs I have ever been thru and hope it is the last.  Gather the friends and family around you that really care about you and what is going on with you. Let people know what they can do for you and your family.
Posts.Title: chemo

Posts.Content: Your sister is so very lucky that you are even asking these questions. I have two sisters adn one of them disappear when I was diagnosed as well as my Mom. So your sisiter is so very lucky to have you for starters. I had a wonderful support group. My husband is a amazing man. He was was with me for all (and still is 2 yrs out) for all my appointments. So was my cousin adn older sister. Just ask your sister what she would like you to do and she will let you now.I liked getting soft things to wear. Socks, p.j's blankets....just let her know you are there to do anything she needs even to just sit by her when she does not feel like talking. You are in my thoughts on this journey,
Posts.Title: Hw can I help?

Posts.Content: If I were you for right now be straight forward and let your friends and family know your needs right now. Tell them e-mailing you may be better for the time being rather than calling. I am sure you are having alot of anxiety about all this. I know I did. Sometimes it is hard to talk about ALL the time.     Good luck...
Posts.Title: Frustrated...

Posts.Content: Without ratting out your other neighbor (which I would really not be too concerned about that) the focus is the neighbor that is ill. I would just go outside one day when you see her outside and ask her if there is anything you can do for her and her family. You do not have to tell her anyone told you anything. Just by her wearing scarves and looking weak she will kno w you obviously know something is going on. When I was going thru treatment the best thing was when people ask me what they could do. You could get the family a grocery gift card, offer to take her to appointments or just ask her if she wants to talk to call or walk across the steet and you will be there for her. I am sure you know all this anyway having dealt with cancer recently with your family. Good luck and make a move to her.... Jennifer
Posts.Title: She doesn't know I know...what to do??I want to say something...

Posts.Content: I have been on Femara for 1 year now. I have hot flashes pretty darn bad,feet,bone and joint pain. I had a bone density test done to see how my bones are dong since I went on the Femara and I have lost bone in my back 5.8% since 1 yr ago. My cholesterol is 232 my LDL and HDL are all out of whack....I am now haing to see a cardiologist for my cholesterol and a endochronologists for the bone loss... All this really stinks...
Posts.Title: side effects from Femara

Posts.Content: I am 47 yrs old and was diagnosed with breast caner at the age of 44. I have been taking Femara for 1 1/2 yrs. I keep telling my onc. that as time goes by my side effects are getting worse. They say in time you will get use to it. Well... guess what? You do not get use to it. It is something you just learn to deal with day in and day out. My bones hurt, Joints hurt, mood swings are horrible, trouble sleeping, energy level bad(even though I work out 4 days a week and push myself to do that), Hair thinning getting worse, bottoms of feet kill me, blah blah..... I tried getting some info from Novartis to see if this was common for side effects to get worse but they will not talk to the person (patient) that is taking the medication they want to talk with the Doctor that you see. The doc will not call them because they are too busy and I cannot get any answers. Seems like they want you to take it and oh well with you.
Posts.Title: femara long term effects

Posts.Content: The best thing you can do is just what you are doing. You are there for her no matter what. That means the most. I had breast cancer. I was diagnosed 8 28 06. I had family (Mom and little sister 37 yo) members vanish when I was diagnosed. My husband (an angel) Dad and older sister were there for me. I cannot put into words what it meant to have there support and concern and caring. It is very sad when that happens.
Posts.Title: 25 y.o. sister told to "prepare for cancer diagnosis."

Posts.Content: I am pretty sure you are correct. If you have already been diagnosed then its no good. It is only for people who have or have had precancerous situations.
Posts.Title: evista

Posts.Content: God bless you Judy!! It made me cry just reading your story. My what a VERY STRONG person you are. We all should be thankful for what we have and what we don't. God bless you and your family...
Posts.Title: Third bout with breast cancer since 1995

Posts.Content: Wow...what better news than that. I am so glad to hear the great news!!!
Posts.Title: 25 y.o. sister told to "prepare for cancer diagnosis."

Posts.Content: I cannot relate to that. But bless you. You have already been thru enough...
Posts.Title: Bilateral BC - 3 new cancer sites

Posts.Content: I had my port placement 9 15 06 and I still have it in. My surgeon said I can keep it in the rest of my life if I choose. I have had no problems with it. But I have a excellent surgeon. Dr.Lipman he is in Marietta,Ga.
Posts.Title: Taxol

Posts.Content: So sorry about your sister. This disease really stinks and I hope they find a cure soon so this will stop.
Posts.Title: another passing of a sisiter
